intro: Adesmia miraflorensis, commonly known as the Miraflores legume, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in narrow, elongated pods that split open when mature to release the seeds. Adesmia miraflorensis is adapted to grow in rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
